Katie Stockton: การกลับตัวลงของ Bitcoin ส่งสัญญาณการเปลี่ยนแปลงตลาด, Ethereum มีแนวโน้มที่จะทำได้ดีกว่าในระยะยาว และบทบาทของการวิเคราะห์ทางเทคนิคในสภาวะที่ผันผวน | Unchained

Katie Stockton: Bitcoin’s bearish reversal signals a market shift, Ethereum set to outperform in the long term, and the role of technical analysis in volatile conditions | Unchained

1d ago//Editorial Team
bitcoinethereum
AI

Summary

TH

Katie Stockton จาก Fairlead Strategies ชี้ให้เห็นว่า Bitcoin ได้เข้าสู่เฟสการกลับตัวลง (bearish reversal) หลังจากราคาตกผ่าน Ichimoku cloud ซึ่งเป็นสัญญาณการเปลี่ยนแปลงครั้งสำคัญจากเทรนด์ขาขึ้นเดิม แม้ว่าตลาดจะมีความรู้สึกเชิงลบอย่างรุนแรงและความผันผวนสูงจากสภาพคล่องที่ต่ำ แต่สภาวะเหล่านี้มักเกิดขึ้นพร้อมกับจุดต่ำสุดของตลาด บ่งชี้ว่าระดับการสนับสนุนทำหน้าที่เป็นเกจวัดความเสี่ยงมากกว่าจะเป็นแม่เหล็กดึงดูดราคา อย่างไรก็ตาม ความผันผวนเหล่านี้ยังคงสร้างโอกาสในการเทรดสำหรับผู้ที่มีความระมัดระวัง ในมุมมองระยะยาว Stockton ยังคงมองโลกในแง่ดีต่อ Ethereum โดยคาดการณ์ว่าจะแข็งแกร่งกว่า Bitcoin ในท้ายที่สุด แม้ว่า Bitcoin จะแสดงความมั่นคงได้ดีในบางช่วงเวลา เธอเน้นย้ำว่าการวิเคราะห์ทางเทคนิคยังคงมีประสิทธิภาพสูงในตลาดคริปโตเนื่องจากความเป็นสากลและรูปแบบการซื้อขาย นอกจากนี้ 她还เชื่อว่าการรวมตัวของราคา (basing phase) ของ Bitcoin ในปัจจุบันอาจช่วยรักษาศักยภาพสำหรับเทรนด์ขาขึ้นตามยุคสมัย (secular bull trend) ให้กลับมาอีกครั้งเมื่อตลาดฟื้นตัว

EN

Katie Stockton of Fairlead Strategies highlights that Bitcoin has entered a bearish reversal phase, signaled by a breakdown below the Ichimoku cloud, marking a significant shift from its previous uptrend. Despite the current extreme bearish sentiment and high volatility driven by thin liquidity, these conditions often coincide with market lows, suggesting that downside risk is being assessed rather than implying a guaranteed bounce. Stockton notes that while stochastic indicators may take months to recover from oversold territory, volatility itself presents trading opportunities for those navigating the market carefully. Looking ahead, Stockton maintains a bullish long-term outlook on Ethereum, predicting it will eventually outperform Bitcoin despite the latter's temporary stability in a risk-off environment. She emphasizes that technical analysis remains highly effective in the crypto space due to global liquidity and trading patterns. Furthermore, she suggests that Bitcoin’s current basing phase could preserve the potential for a secular bull trend to resurface once market conditions stabilize.

Key Points

  • Bitcoin signals a bearish reversal after breaking below the Ichimoku cloud.
  • Extreme bearish sentiment suggests the market may be nearing a low point.
  • Ethereum is poised to outperform Bitcoin in the long term.
  • Technical analysis is effective in crypto due to global liquidity and trading patterns.
  • Support levels gauge downside risk rather than acting as price magnets.

Article

Bitcoin's bearish reversal hints at a potential market low amid rising volatility and shifting sentiment. Key Takeaways Technical analysis is particularly effective in crypto markets due to their global trading and liquidity. The recent uptrend in Bitcoin has reversed, indicating a significant change in market conditions. The Ichimoku model is used to gauge primary trends and potential support and resistance levels in price. Bitcoin has entered a bearish reversal phase as indicated by the breakdown below the Ichimoku cloud. Historically, when the stochastic oscillator reaches oversold territory, it can take months to recover. A combination of indicators is essential for making informed trading decisions in volatile markets. Current bearish sentiment in Bitcoin could indicate a potential low point for the market. Thin liquidity in crypto markets can lead to dramatic price movements. Bitcoin’s volatility has its own cycles influenced by macroeconomic conditions and political headlines. Ethereum is poised to outperform Bitcoin in the long term despite Bitcoin’s current stability. The market is likely to experience further downside volatility before bottoming out. Support levels serve as gauges of potential downside risk rather than acting as magnets for price. Cryptocurrencies are among the first assets to be penalized when market sentiment turns negative. Guest intro Katie Stockton, CMT, is Founder and Managing Partner of Fairlead Strategies, LLC, an independent research firm and registered investment advisor based in Greenwich, Connecticut, that specializes in technical analysis. She previously served as Chief Technical Strategist at BTIG and Chief Market Technician at MKM Partners. Katie is recognized as a CNBC Contributor for her coverage of US equities and bitcoin. Why technical analysis thrives in crypto markets “Cryptocurrencies have been lending themselves very well to technical analysis” – Katie Stockton Technical analysis is effective due to the global trading and liquidity of crypto markets. Support and resistance levels are key areas of buying and selling pressure on the charts. “The uptrend that we could draw back to the $20.22 low has certainly reversed itself” – Katie Stockton Reversal of Bitcoin’s uptrend indicates a significant change in market conditions. The Ichimoku model is popular internationally for gauging primary trends. “We saw the bottom boundary of the so-called cloud taken out” – Katie Stockton Breakdown below the Ichimoku cloud signals a bearish reversal in Bitcoin. Understanding the Ichimoku model and its implications The Ichimoku model helps gauge primary trends and potential support and resistance levels. “It’s derived from midpoints of price” – Katie Stockton Breakdown below the Ichimoku cloud indicates a bearish reversal in Bitcoin. “We saw that breakdown below the cloud” – Katie Stockton The model is popular internationally and provides a comprehensive view of market trends. Knowledge of the Ichimoku cloud is essential for understanding trend analysis. The model’s components are used to assess market conditions and predict price movements. “The Ichimoku model is designed to gauge the primary trend” – Katie Stockton Trading opportunities in a bearish market “It’s not to say that within that framework we won’t have opportunities to trade Bitcoin” – Katie Stockton Volatility in bear cycles can present trading opportunities. Counter-trend trading from a shorter-term perspective is possible. “There are still trading opportunities in Bitcoin even during a bear cycle” – Katie Stockton Awareness of market volatility is key to identifying trading opportunities. “Historically, when the stochastic oscillator reaches oversold territory, it can take months to recover” – Katie Stockton The stochastic oscillator’s oversold condition can indicate potential trading opportunities. “It took months and even at times more than just months to get out of that oversold condition” – Katie Stockton The role of sentiment and indicators in market predictions “The sentiment data is pretty extremely bearish” – Katie Stockton Bearish sentiment can indicate a potential low point for the market. Sentiment analysis influences market predictions and trading strategies. “That would be conducive to a low” – Katie Stockton A combination of indicators is essential for making informed trading decisions. “We use a combination of indicators” – Katie Stockton The weight of the evidence approach evaluates market conditions before adding exposure. “We don’t have the weight of the evidence right now to give us confidence to add exposure” – Katie Stockton Navigating market volatility with technical analysis “Thin liquidity in crypto markets can lead to dramatic price movements” – Katie Stockton Market conditions can influence price volatility, crucial for traders and investors. Support levels in crypto are not precise points but rather areas. “Support levels don’t act as magnets really” – Katie Stockton “They are more just gauges of potential downside risk” – Katie Stockton Understanding the dynamics of liquidity and price movements is essential. “A bounce could be very dramatic in the same way that the downdraft was dramatic” – Katie Stockton Market participant variability affects support levels in technical analysis. Long-term trends and the future of Ethereum “Bitcoin’s volatility has its own cycles” – Katie Stockton Bitcoin’s price movements and volatility are influenced by macroeconomic conditions. Ethereum is poised to outperform Bitcoin in the long term. “The longer-term trend does indeed favor ETH” – Katie Stockton Bitcoin’s current stability in a risk-off environment is temporary. “That to me in a way preserves the potential for the secular bull trend to resurface” – Katie Stockton Understanding the factors influencing Bitcoin’s price movements is crucial. “It has the ability to almost maybe move into a basing phase” – Katie Stockton The impact of sentiment on market stabilization “We may see some stabilization in the market due to extremely bearish sentiment readings” – Katie Stockton The fear and greed index reflects current market sentiment. “We certainly wouldn’t be surprised to see some stabilization” – Katie Stockton Extremely bearish sentiment can lead to market stabilization. “Looking at the Bitcoin fear and greed index” – Katie Stockton Sentiment analysis is crucial for investors seeking potential entry points. “Very extremely bearish sentiment reading” – Katie Stockton Understanding market sentiment is key to predicting potential price movements. Bitcoin’s role as a proxy for altcoin trading Altcoins generally follow Bitcoin’s price movements. “You can spend the most time understanding Bitcoin and that can inform your bias” – Katie Stockton Bitcoin is a useful proxy for trading smaller coins. Altcoins tend to bottom and top around the same time as Bitcoin. “They tend to bottom right around the same time and top right around the same time” – Katie Stockton Using Bitcoin as a top-down proxy for smaller coins is the best approach for now. “Using Bitcoin as sort of the top-down proxy for these smaller coins is the way to go” – Katie Stockton Understanding the relationship between Bitcoin and altcoins is crucial for trading. The influence of technical indicators on trading strategies “Technical indicators can help navigate market sentiment” – Katie Stockton Indicators improve trading probabilities by assessing market conditions. “They will at least put more probabilities in our favor” – Katie Stockton Technical indicators are inherently lagging but help eliminate noise. “Most technical indicators are lagging” – Katie Stockton Understanding the role of technical indicators is crucial for trading strategies. “They can help us eliminate some of the noise” – Katie Stockton Indicators identify meaningful trends and improve trading decisions. The cyclical nature of markets and investment opportunities “The current market may be an off year for certain trends” – Katie Stockton Off years present potential buying opportunities in the future. “We can ultimately have a great buying opportunity to take advantage of” – Katie Stockton Understanding market cycles is crucial for strategic investments. “The pullbacks in silver and gold may indicate the start of a new cycle” – Katie Stockton Pullbacks can signal the beginning of new market cycles. “The pullbacks do look like the start of this kind of newer cycle” – Katie Stockton Recognizing market trends helps identify investment opportunities.
